questions.text: Tulip was sitting on a bench talking to Danny in the opening scene. What was the name of the company she asked Danni about?
questions.explanation:
Grail Industries.

	Tulip asked what kind of company Grail Industries was and Danni told her it was none of their business. They talked a few moments longer, Danni handed her a scrap of paper with an address on it and the camera panned away from them.

questions.text: DeBlanc and Fiore, who were killed and somehow resurrected in the previous episode, were staying in a motel. What was the name of the motel?
questions.explanation:
Sundowner.

	They were talking with the town sheriff in their first scene in the episode. They claimed to be undercover government agents and convinced the sheriff to let them investigate around town without interference. It wasn't explained how they came back from the dead after Cassidy killed and dismembered them.

questions.text: Several school children made fun of the man the Preacher had fought with in the pilot. Where was the man when they started screaming at him?
options: On TV for a local news segment
At the playground at the middle school
In the children's ward at the hospital
questions.explanation:
On the school bus.

	The kids all started yelling at the man to "squeal like a bunny". He still was sporting his broken right arm, and had tried to make amends with his son for hurting his wife.

questions.text: Tulip was pulled over for speeding while traveling in Texas. What happened during the stop?
questions.correct: She faked a military background and talked her way out of the ticket.
options: Jesse sped past going even faster and the cop decided to chase him.
She attacked the officer and left him unconscious on the side of the road.
questions.explanation:
She faked a military background and talked her way out of the ticket.

	The trooper told her he clocked her going 115 miles per hour in a 55 miles per hour zone. He was going to arrest her and impound the car, and she had a pistol ready to stop that from happening. She was able to talk her way out of it before resorting to violence.

questions.text: Who was the first person Jesse told about his newfound powers?
questions.explanation:
Cassidy.

	Cassidy happened upon Jesse in the back room of the church, he was sitting in the dark. During a conversation Jesse told him of the powers he was discovering and said it felt like he was a blender inside. He described all of the emotions he was feeling all at once. Jesse at first thought it was a curse, but Cassidy tried to talk him into using the ability for his own purposes.

questions.text: Jackie Earle Hayley made his series debut as a wealthy business man named after which Norse god?
questions.explanation:
Odin.

	Of the options only Odin was a Norse god. The character, Odin Quincannon, was written into the comics as a parable for Ross Perot. The character made his fortune in the meat packing industry.

questions.text: Cassidy was forced to go out during the day. What was the errand he was tasked with?
options: Picking up more wine for the church
Buying parts for the air conditioner for the rectory
Finding a new source of blood to keep him healthy
questions.explanation:
Going to the crematorium.

	Before he ran into Jesse earlier in the episode he was given a task of taking a body to the crematorium. The church secretary told him is was time that he start helping around there. He dressed in heavy clothes and large hat to get to the crematorium in the church van. In this series Cassidy, a vampire, can go out in the daylight but it bothers him greatly.

questions.text: Did Jesse help Tulip with her vengeance?
questions.explanation:
No.

	They met up on the side of the road. At first he was reticent to listen to her, but then she convinced him that his promise to be a "good" guy was that of a child, not a man. She showed him the address she had acquired at the beginning of the episode, then they sped away in her car. Before they could get to Carlos, Jesse changed his mind and told Tulip they should "leave him to god", rather than seek their own vengeance.

questions.text: While the show is set in Texas, Tulip's car is registered to another state. Where was the car from?
questions.explanation:
Illinois.

	There is a scene where Tulip was stopped at a gas station, the camera starts low and pans across the front of the car. The license plate was heavily featured in the shot. The scene ended up with Jesse telling Tulip he needed to go to the bathroom and him getting attacked by Donnie, who was brandishing a pistol. Using his newfound powers Jesse nearly made Donnie shoot himself in the head before he thought better of it and left him sitting on a toilet crying.

questions.text: DeBlanc and Fiore claimed to be being sent from ______ to find the power that was inside of the preacher. What word is missing?
questions.explanation:
Heaven.

	DeBlanc and Fiore claimed to be sent from Heaven when they were talking with Cassidy. This was after Cassidy had already killed them twice within the first three episodes. While he was about to kill them for the third time they convinced him they weren't vampire hunters and then told him their story.
